title: Episode 4-3 Highlights | "I Was Worried" Kim Soo-hyun's Growing Concern for His Sick Wife Kim Ji-won
synopsis: Hye-in's mother-in-law attacks her with vicious accusations, calling her 'rotten to the bone.' Hyun-woo steps in to protect her. Later, he urges her to tell her family about her illness, but Hye-in reveals her heartbreaking reason: her parents already lost one child. When Hye-in visits his hometown and goes missing, Hyun-woo panics—only to find her confused and scared, unable to remember how she got there. Her terrifying confession about memory loss marks a turning point in their relationship.

contents.original: 너 윤은성한테 수철이에 대해서 뭐라고 한 거니? 뭐라고 가운데서 이간질을 했길래 윤 대표가 요리 빼고 조리 빼는 거냐고 지금.
contents.pronunciation: Neo Yun Eunseong-hante Sucheor-i-e daehae-seo mworago han geoni? Mworago gaunde-seo iganjir-eul haetgillae Yun daepyo-ga yori ppaego jori ppaeneun geonyago jigeum.
contents.translation: What did you say to Yoon Eun-sung about Soo-cheol? What kind of backstabbing did you do that CEO Yoon is now making excuses left and right?

grammar.example: 이간질을 했길래 = because you backstabbed

grammar.pattern: 요리 빼고 조리 빼다 (yori ppaego jori ppaeda)
grammar.explanation: Idiom meaning 'to make excuses/dodge this way and that'
grammar.example: 요리 빼고 조리 빼는 거냐고 = asking why he's dodging

contents.culture: Mother-in-law Mo Seul-hee accusing Hye-in of sabotaging her son Soo-cheol's business deal with Eun-sung.

contents.original: 무슨 이간질.
contents.pronunciation: Museun iganjil.
contents.translation: What backstabbing.

grammar.example: 무슨 이간질 = what backstabbing (I didn't)

contents.original: 뻔하지. 수철이 리저브 투자받으면 니가 밀린다. 그러니까 수철이한테 투자하지 말고 염상진이한테 해줘라.
contents.pronunciation: Ppeonhaji. Sucheor-i rijеobeu tuja-badeumyeon niga millinda. Geureonikka Sucheor-i-hante tuja-haji malgo Yeom Sangjin-i-hante haejwora.
contents.translation: It's obvious. If Soo-cheol gets Reserve investment, you get pushed aside. So you told him not to invest in Soo-cheol but in Yeom Sang-jin instead.

grammar.example: 뻔하지 = it's obvious

grammar.explanation: Verb meaning 'to be pushed aside/fall behind'
grammar.example: 니가 밀린다 = you get pushed aside

contents.original: 그래야 회장님 노발대발을 하실 거니까.
contents.pronunciation: Geuraeya hoejang-nim nobaldaebal-eul hasil geonikka.
contents.translation: That way the Chairman will be furious.

grammar.example: 노발대발을 하실 거니까 = because he'll be furious

contents.original: 그게 지금 말이 된다고 생각하세요?
contents.pronunciation: Geuge jigeum mar-i doendago saenggak-haseyo?
contents.translation: Do you think that even makes sense?

grammar.example: 말이 된다고 생각하세요? = do you think it makes sense?

contents.original: 응. 난 니가 그러고도 남을 애라고 생각해. 너는 너만 생각하는 뼛속까지 나쁜 년이니까.
contents.pronunciation: Eung. Nan niga geureogodo nameul ae-rago saenggakhae. Neoneun neoman saenggak-haneun ppyeotsok-kkaji nappeun nyeon-inikka.
contents.translation: Yes. I think you're capable of that and more. Because you're a girl who only thinks of herself—rotten to the bone.

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'capable of that and more'
grammar.example: 그러고도 남을 애 = a kid who could do that and more

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'to the bone/through and through'
grammar.example: 뼛속까지 나쁜 년 = rotten to the bone

contents.culture: Extremely harsh insult from mother-in-law—'년' (nyeon) is a derogatory term for women. This level of verbal abuse from in-laws is a painful reality in some Korean family dynamics.

contents.original: 넌 니 옆에서 사람이 죽어 나가든 말든 그저 너 살 길만 찾잖아.
contents.pronunciation: Neon ni yeop-eseo saram-i jugeo nagadeun maldeun geujeo neo sal gil-man chatjana.
contents.translation: You just look for ways to save yourself, whether people around you die or not.

grammar.example: 죽어 나가든 말든 = whether they die or not
살 길만 찾잖아 = you only look for ways to survive

contents.culture: Cruel irony—the mother-in-law doesn't know Hye-in is actually dying.

contents.original: 혜인이가 아침부터 컨디션이 좀 안 좋았습니다. 들어가 좀 쉬어야 할 것 같습니다. 죄송합니다 어머니.
contents.pronunciation: Hyein-iga achim-buteo keondisyeon-i jom an joasseumnida. Deureoga jom swieoya hal geot gatsseumnida. Joesonghamnida eomeoni.
contents.translation: Hye-in hasn't been feeling well since this morning. I think she needs to go rest. I'm sorry, Mother.

grammar.example: 컨디션이 안 좋다 = not feeling well

contents.culture: Hyun-woo stepping in to protect Hye-in from her mother-in-law's attack—a significant moment showing his growing protectiveness.

contents.original: 그래서 지금 나더러 가라는 거야? 내가 지금 말하고 있는데?
contents.pronunciation: Geuraeseo jigeum nadeoreo garaneun geoya? Naega jigeum malhago inneunde?
contents.translation: So you're telling ME to leave? While I'm still talking?

grammar.example: 나더러 가라는 거야 = are you telling me to leave

contents.culture: The mother-in-law is offended that Hyun-woo, a son-in-law from a humble background, would interrupt her.

contents.original: 죄송합니다.
contents.pronunciation: Joesonghamnida.
contents.translation: I'm sorry.

grammar.example: 죄송합니다 = I'm sorry

contents.original: 가족들한테 얘기하자.
contents.pronunciation: Gajok-deul-hante yaegi-haja.
contents.translation: Let's tell your family.

grammar.example: 얘기하자 = let's talk/tell

contents.original: 안 된다고 했지.
contents.pronunciation: An doendago haetji.
contents.translation: I said no.

grammar.example: 안 된다고 했지 = I said it won't work

contents.original: 아까 같은 상황은 언제든지 생길 수 있어. 들키기 싫어도 들킬 수 있다고.
contents.pronunciation: Akka gateun sanghwang-eun eonjedeun-ji saenggil su isseo. Deulkigi sireodo deulkil su itdago.
contents.translation: Situations like earlier can happen anytime. Even if you don't want to be found out, you could be.

grammar.example: 언제든지 생길 수 있어 = can happen anytime
들킬 수 있다고 = you could be found out

contents.original: 나 치료 받잖아. 왜 내일모레 죽을 사람 취급해?
contents.pronunciation: Na chiryo batjana. Wae naeil-more jugeul saram chwi-geup-hae?
contents.translation: I'm getting treatment. Why are you treating me like I'm dying tomorrow?

grammar.example: 내일모레 죽을 사람 = someone dying any day now
환자 취급해 = treating like a patient

contents.original: 너 이거 이기적이고 무책임한 거야.
contents.pronunciation: Neo igeo igijeoging-o muchaeg-imhan geoya.
contents.translation: This is selfish and irresponsible of you.

grammar.example: 이기적이고 = selfish and
무책임한 거야 = it's irresponsible

contents.original: 그래. 1조 클럽도 좋고 돈, 주식 다 좋아.
contents.pronunciation: Geurae. Iljo keullеob-do joko don, jusik da joa.
contents.translation: Fine. The trillion club is nice, money, stocks—all great.

grammar.example: 1조 클럽 = trillion club

contents.original: 너 아픈 거 밝혀지면 가족들한테 니 거 뺏길까 봐 걱정되는 것도 알겠어.
contents.pronunciation: Neo apeun geo balkhyeojimyeon gajok-deul-hante ni geo ppae-atgilkka bwa geokjeong-doeneun geotdo algetsseo.
contents.translation: I understand you're worried that if your illness is revealed, your family might take what's yours.

grammar.example: 아픈 거 밝혀지면 = if the illness is revealed

grammar.explanation: Passive verb meaning 'to have taken away'
grammar.example: 뺏길까 봐 = worried it might be taken

contents.culture: In chaebol families, illness or weakness can lead to power struggles and asset seizures.

contents.original: 근데 손에 쥔 거 하나도 안 놓치고 싶어서 이런 중요한 일을 아무한테도 얘기 안 하는 게 맞니?
contents.pronunciation: Geunde son-e jwin geo hanado an nochigo sipеoseo irеon jungyohan ir-eul amu-hante-do yaegi an haneun ge manni?
contents.translation: But is it right to not tell anyone about something this important just because you don't want to let go of anything you have?

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'to hold in one's hands'
grammar.example: 손에 쥔 거 = what you're holding
안 놓치고 싶어서 = because you don't want to let go

contents.original: 그게 정말 맞아?
contents.pronunciation: Geuge jeongmal maja?
contents.translation: Is that really right?

grammar.example: 그게 정말 맞아? = is that really right?

contents.original: 놀랄까 봐 그래.
contents.pronunciation: Nollalkka bwa geurae.
contents.translation: I'm worried they'll be shocked.

grammar.example: 놀랄까 봐 = worried they'll be shocked

contents.original: 우리 엄마, 아빤 자식을 먼저 보낸 사람들이고.
contents.pronunciation: Uri eomma, appan jasik-eul meonjeo bonaen saram-deul-igo.
contents.translation: My mom and dad are people who already lost a child.

grammar.explanation: Euphemism meaning 'to lose a child before oneself'
grammar.example: 자식을 먼저 보낸 사람들 = people who lost a child

contents.culture: Hye-in reveals her parents already lost her older brother (오빠) - a devastating trauma. In Korean culture, outliving your children is considered the greatest tragedy.

contents.original: 괜히 겁줄 필요 있어.
contents.pronunciation: Gwaenhi geop-jul pilyo isseo.
contents.translation: There's no need to scare them for nothing.

grammar.example: 괜히 겁줄 필요 = need to scare for nothing
겁줄 필요 있어 = is there need to scare

contents.original: 어차피 난 현연 글렀고 그냥 가족에게 더 끔찍한 존재가 되고 싶지 않을 뿐이야.
contents.pronunciation: Eochapi nan hyeonyeon geulleotgo geunyang gajok-ege deo kkeumjjikhan jonjae-ga doego sipji anheul ppun-iya.
contents.translation: Anyway, I've already given up on having children, and I just don't want to become an even more terrible burden to my family.

grammar.example: 현연 글렀고 = given up on having children
끔찍한 존재 = terrible existence/burden
싶지 않을 뿐이야 = I just don't want to

contents.culture: 현연 (hyeonyeon) refers to having children/continuing the bloodline—a huge pressure in chaebol families.

contents.original: 그리고 무엇보다 난 나을 자신이 있어.
contents.pronunciation: Geurigo muеotboda nan naeul jasin-i isseo.
contents.translation: And more than anything, I'm confident I'll recover.

grammar.example: 무엇보다 = more than anything
나을 자신이 있어 = I'm confident I'll recover

contents.original: 그러니까 환자 취급 그만하고. 나가줄래? 좀 쉬고 싶어.
contents.pronunciation: Geureonikka hwanja chwi-geup geuman-hago. Nagajullae? Jom swigo sipeo.
contents.translation: So stop treating me like a patient. Can you leave? I want to rest.

grammar.example: 환자 취급 그만하고 = stop treating me like a patient
나가줄래? = can you leave?

contents.original: 어떻게 된 거야. 왜 여기 있냐고!
contents.pronunciation: Eotteoke doen geoya. Wae yeogi innyago!
contents.translation: What happened? Why are you here?!

grammar.example: 어떻게 된 거야 = what happened

contents.culture: Hyun-woo's panic when he finds Hye-in in an unexpected place in his rural hometown.

contents.original: 왜 화를 내.
contents.pronunciation: Wae hwa-reul nae.
contents.translation: Why are you getting angry?

grammar.example: 왜 화를 내 = why are you angry

contents.original: 갑자기 니가 여기 와 있다고 하는데 왔더니 넌 집에 없고 회관에도 없고 어디 있는지 아는 사람도 없고 핸드폰도 안 받고.
contents.pronunciation: Gapjagi niga yeogi wa itdago haneunde watdeoni neon jib-e eopgo hoegwan-еdo eopgo eodi inneun-ji aneun saram-do eopgo haendeup-on-do an batgo.
contents.translation: I suddenly heard you were here, but when I came, you weren't at the house, not at the community center, no one knew where you were, and you weren't answering your phone.

grammar.example: 왔더니 = when I came
회관에도 없고 = not at the community center either

contents.original: 그래서 난 산책 나왔어.
contents.pronunciation: Geuraeseo nan sanchaek nawasseo.
contents.translation: So I went out for a walk.

grammar.example: 산책 나왔어 = I came out for a walk

contents.original: 길도 모르는 동네에서 산책을 했다고?
contents.pronunciation: Gil-do moreuneun dongne-eseo sanchaek-eul haetdago?
contents.translation: You went for a walk in a neighborhood you don't even know?

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'don't even know the way'
grammar.example: 길도 모르는 동네 = a neighborhood you don't know

contents.original: 그래.
contents.pronunciation: Geurae.
contents.translation: Yeah.

grammar.example: 그래 = yeah

contents.original: 걱정했잖아.
contents.pronunciation: Geokjeong-haetjana.
contents.translation: I was worried.

grammar.example: 걱정했잖아 = I was worried (you know)

contents.culture: Key moment—Hyun-woo admitting he was genuinely worried about her.

contents.original: 왜 걱정해. 환자 취급하지 말랬지.
contents.pronunciation: Wae geokjeong-hae. Hwanja chwi-geup-haji mallаetji.
contents.translation: Why worry? I told you not to treat me like a patient.

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'I told you not to'
grammar.example: 하지 말랬지 = I told you not to

contents.original: 그래, 그랬지. 큰 소리 냈으면 미안하다.
contents.pronunciation: Geurae, geuraetji. Keun sori naesseumyeon mianhada.
contents.translation: Yeah, I did. Sorry if I raised my voice.

grammar.example: 큰 소리 냈으면 = if I raised my voice

contents.original: 사실은 기억이 안 나.
contents.pronunciation: Sasir-eun gieok-i an na.
contents.translation: Actually, I don't remember.

grammar.example: 기억이 안 나 = I don't remember

contents.culture: The terrifying symptom of her brain tumor—memory loss episodes.

contents.original: 기억이 하나도 안 나 내가 왜 거기 있었는지.
contents.pronunciation: Gieok-i hanado an na naega wae geogi isseossneunji.
contents.translation: I don't remember at all why I was there.

grammar.example: 기억이 하나도 안 나 = don't remember at all

contents.original: 분명히 대문 앞이었는데 정신 차리고 보니까 모르는 데 서 있었어.
contents.pronunciation: Bunmyeonghi daemun ap-ieossnuende jeongsin charigo bonikka moreuneun de seo isseosseo.
contents.translation: I was definitely at the front gate, but when I came to my senses, I was standing somewhere I didn't know.

grammar.example: 분명히 대문 앞이었는데 = I was definitely at the gate

grammar.explanation: Expression meaning 'to come to one's senses'
grammar.example: 정신 차리고 보니까 = when I came to my senses

contents.original: 내가 언제 갔는지도 모르겠고 어떻게 갔는지도 모르겠어.
contents.pronunciation: Naega eonje gatneunji-do moreugessgo eotteoke gatneunji-do moreugesseo.
contents.translation: I don't know when I went or how I got there.

grammar.example: 언제 갔는지도 모르겠고 = don't even know when I went

contents.original: 너무 무서웠어.
contents.pronunciation: Neomu museowosseo.
contents.translation: I was so scared.

grammar.example: 너무 무서웠어 = I was so scared

contents.culture: Hye-in's rare moment of vulnerability—admitting fear to Hyun-woo. This confession deepens their emotional intimacy.
